rComments: Prof. Light spent a lot of time ensuring that we could understand the statistical concepts, and provided many opportunities to ask questions and seek help. The assignments were fairly graded, and not that difficult. We chose what to write about, and when to hand in the reading responses. Tests were a bit tough but improvement was possible.

Professor Light is an amazing lecturer and a very honest and considerate human being. He always makes times for his students in order to make sure concepts are understood and will go out of his way to assist you if you find yourself struggling. That being said his classes and the assigned material is intensive. Get ready to study

He teaches extremely difficult material, and yes, he has a big focus on Russia because it's a great focus for the courses he teaches (Org Crime, etc). He is extremely terse, because that's his manner, which may come off as brusque to some, especially if you're disengaged, but if you actually speak to him personally, he is a very kind-hearted man.

Honestly wouldn't suggest taking any class with him. He can be super rude to students, is super conceited, and his tests are unrealistically and pointlessly difficult. He also manages to somehow make every class about Russia. Not what I expected the class to be about at all. More like a history class with him...
Super hard course! You must seek out his help to do well, so go to office hours. He does provide a lot of opportunities to do so.
